channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AZ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AZ

item.title: Report X-2023060966
item.description:
Report X-2023060966

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0

item.title: Report I-2023060054
item.description:
Report I-2023060054

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-05
  • City: Phoenix
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHWEST AIRLINES CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Flight 757 arrived in PHX from OAK. While Ramp Agents were offloading the passenger's bags, They noticed the bag in question was smoking. When agents opened the bag to investigate, they found a soldering iron that was activated. After we advised the passenger of the issue, the Passenger realized he forgot to remove the batteries and transport the heat-producing article in carryon baggage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package went out for delivery May 30th 2023 which was refused for being damaged. May 31st 2023 package was taken to the hazmat cage to be inspected. DescribePack: 1/2 cans have dents towards the top rim of the cans which then caused an opening. Approximately 2 cups have soiled the interior of the packaging. Eating the Styrofoam. DurationRel: 26 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a hazardous bag and tote, taken to the hazmat cage for inspection.

item.description:
Report X-2023060265

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found during unload, morning of 5/25. The exterior box is soaked through. The package was placed in a lined, hazmat bin, then left under the vent in the hazmat cage. DescribePack: It appears that one of the bottles had a loose cap, resulting in spillage through and throughout the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately placed in a lined tote, along with absorbent pads to keep the spillage containted.

item.title: Report E-2023050511
item.description:
Report E-2023050511

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-04
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 4, 2023, one (1) 2.3-gallon pail of sodium hydroxide was damaged and released approximately 0.5 gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. GES personnel overpacked the damaged pail in one (1) 15-gallon drum. The crew then utilized absorbents and hand tools to further remediate the impacted surfaces. All UN1824 impacted material was placed in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

When it was discovered the package was placed upright in a hazmat bag lined tote and brought to the QA area. DescribePack: The metal pail fell over causing the rim to dent therefore causing the leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed upright causing the leak to stop.

item.title: Report X-2023050444
item.description:
Report X-2023050444

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-04
  • City: CHANDLER
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was unloaded around 3 am and was noticed leaking some powder. The package was placed in a hazardous materials bag and a red hazardous tote, Placed in the hazmat cage for inspection. DescribePack: Package was inspected which concluded the screw on lid had a small opening which contributed to the powder leaking. Estimated less than a cup was lost. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Package was place in the appropriate bag and tote and in the correct location for being damaged. Hazardous materials bag, red hazardous tote and placed in the cage @ the exhaust vent for further inspection.

DescribePack: The product's cap was too loose and leaked in the box then it was spread the side of box then it became wet/torn. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA placed it in the hazardous bag in the tote.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Metal pail was being unloaded and when it was being set onto the dock it toppled over causing the crimped rim to bend denting the top and ultimately breaking the seal on the lid causing it to leak. DescribePack: The crimped rim of the lid DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Since only a small amount of liquid leaked out of the metal pail the leak was stopped as soon as the pail was set upright.
